boardgame.name: Adventure Outfitters: Adventuring Arsenal
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Adventurer Outfitters, a series dedicated to presenting new items and mechanics that can provide exciting and fun choices for characters.

Adventuring Arsenal reprints the expanded survival mechanic, which allows characters to not just survive in the wilderness, but trully thrive. In addition to this are new types of ammunition for rangers/hunters; as well as new so-called 'meta items' designed to give players new options that traditionally are not available in regular play.

boardgame.name: The Summoner
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Meet your life-long friend that will stick with you through thick and thin. The summoner class allows you to start off with a companion and when that isn’t enough, you gain the power to summon other allies to suit your needs of the moment. Over time, your power and the powers of your companion grow over time, and the two of you make an unassailable pair and you eventually reach a point where the two of you become one.

Designed for the 5th edition ruleset, the Summoner class offers a bonded companion at 1st level along with spellcasting abilities. Upon reaching 2nd level the summoner gains the ability to conjure others creatures from the ether. As the summoner increases in level, her companion gains new abilities and the creatures from which the summoner may conjure become more fearsome. And eventually the summoner gains the ability to infuse her companion with herself and learns to summon other creatures for indefinite periods of time.

boardgame.name: Spell Variants & Exotic Components: Level VII
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A useful handbook containing level 6 spell's variants and new components to empower each spell.

Alchemy Jug
Candle of Invocation
Cold Iron
Elemental Gem of Fire
Fingernail of a Hag
Flask of Troll’s blood
Immovable Rod
Iron Bands of Bilarro
Helm of Teleportation
Plate Armor of Etherealness
Powder of a Ghost
Ring of Elemental Command
Scale of a Black Dragon
Scale of a Blue Dragon
Scale of a Green Dragon
Scale of a Red Dragon
Scale of a Shadow Dragon
Scale of a Silver Dragon
Scale of a White Dragon
Snake of a Medusa’s head
Staff of Fire
Staff of Illusions

boardgame.name: Libram of Lost Spells, Volume 10
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Libram of Lost Spells takes you on a trip through time to reach back to older editions of the 'World's Most Popular Roleplaying Game' and enjoy some of the greatest spells of those days of yore, forgotten to the current game's 5th edition.

We've recreated these spells with great care, bringing them to life again for the 5th edition of the game. Each volume presents 20 "new" spells that you may recognize with great fondness.

Enjoy the nostolgia of these great spells once more or just interject some surprises of new spells into your games today!

boardgame.name: Swords
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Every fantasy hero campaign needs magical treasures for the adventures to find.

This series houses information on varies information on just such treasures.

Sword – Who hasn’t dreamed of finding a magical sword in their adventures? Swords that will let loose a blast of fire or even lightning; a sword that will shoot forth the breathe of a dragon. Swords that will kill giants or demons, a sword that will cut off the head of an enemy will little effort. Here is where you will find the information on such swords. Here you will find the treasure adventurers dream of.

boardgame.name: Monster Mash Collection #1
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the inaugural installment of Monster Mash. Here you will find new creatures and/or new takes on old creatures for your Fantasy Hero Campaign.

This installment will cover a new creatures known as Draklings, Girallon, Hell Tiger, Elementals, Occulord & Shadow Wolf. These creatures will add a new dimension to you Fantasy Hero campaigns.

These creatures range in size, power and abilities. The creatures will challenge adventurers in many ways. Adventurers need a challenge and these creatures will challenge them.

boardgame.name: Reflections Beneath the Sand
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

5th Edition Mini-Dungeon for four to five characters of levels 8-9

The port city of Tarakesh lies on the southern edge of the Great Desert. It is a harsh city filled with pirates and tomb raiders in search of ancient crypts to plunder. In a seedy tavern the party meets a beautiful pirate captain named Nicole Christine. She is selling a map which leads through the desert to a tomb filled with riches beyond imagination. She would investigate herself, but alas, her crew grows restless spending too much time ashore.

For the mere price of 250 gp, the party can have the map, and all the riches the tomb contains!

boardgame.name: Improbable Villains Volume Three
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Improbable Villains brings you more villains both strang and singular:

Improbable Villains includes:

Strike-Out - Enigmatic Sports-Themed Vigilante
Squamous Sid - Poor Schlub Who Made a Faustian Deal with Tentacled Evil
Permafrost - Frosty Foot-Soldier for a Meta-Human Supremacist Group
Nimbus- Talent Agent to the Underworld
Doctor Dendrite - Living Brain in a Robot Body who Dreams of World Conquest...

boardgame.name: WEAPONS
WEAPONS!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Never played BattleSauce? Say wha?! It's ok! We can still fix this. You have plenty of time. BattleSauce is a rules light RPBG - all of the flavor, none of the fat. Create complex engaging charactes in minutes and get started playing right away! But "how" you ask?

Grab the FREE BattleSauce Rulebook - yes FREE! It's in all caps so you know we're serious. Then create an awesome character - CHEF, WERETHING, MANIMAL, BARBARIAN, WAR WITCH, or GHOST in just a few minutes and get ready to rumble. You should probably actually read the BattleSauce Rulebook too. There are FREE BattleSauce games on DriveThru and on the BattleSauce website. Did I say BattleSauce enough?

Mobile friendly layout and design.
Brief introduction to BattleSauce gameplay.
Role playing light if any at all. I mean, they're snacks!
Game ready map(s).

boardgame.name: Caverns of Calamity: Kobold's Fury
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An Introductory Module for Player Characters Levels 1-3
Compatible with OSRIC and Most Fantasy RPG systems

A traveler from distant lands threatens the fragile peace of Dùn Loachas.
He brings his new gods and a desire to unite local humanoid tribes for war.
You are the only ones standing in this madman’s way, can you save the day?

Greetings adventurers and Game Masters!

I am very happy to announce release of “CAVERNS OF CALAMITY: KOBOLD’S FURY”. This introductory level module is the first in a series of three interconnected adventures intended for neophyte adventurers of levels 1 to 3.

Synopsis: In this adventure your players will be employed by the Gnomish Advanced Research Institute (G.A.R.I. for short), an inventor’s organization. They are tasked with the search for and recovery of a rare plant from the other side of the known world.

The black market sellers of this rare botanical treasure (rumoured to be a plant with broad, shiny oval leaves known as a “rubber plant”) were intent in keeping their identity a secret. Unfortunately for them, once this exotic plant came to the attention of the ever inquisitive and highly resourceful gnomes they quickly discovered (through diligent sleuthing, liberal bribes and much snooping) the course of the plants: a set of caverns in the far southern foothills of Dùn Loachas. A G.A.R.I. expedition was organized swiftly and set off in search of these botanical rarities, but they never returned!

Unbeknown to the gnomes, their expeditionary team was walking into the dragon’s den! For the cavern was guarded by a pack of bloodthirsty humanoids, intent on keeping this valuable prize to themselves. They captured and killed the gnome researchers, in hopes of quashing any outside knowledge of their valuable.

So the gnomes have turned to professional adventurers to save the day. They gnomes need the players to investigate the caverns, recover the plants they need for their research, and find and rescue members of the prior expeditionary force, if at all possible.

Are your players up to the challenge?

While written as the first in a series of adventures, it may also be run as a stand-alone adventure; there is guidance throughout the module on how the GM may run it in either mode (stand-alone or series). The “CAVERNS OF CALAMITY” series will continue in the upcoming module “SO 19 GOBLIN’S RAGE” and conclude in “SO20 ORC’S WRATH”, coming soon (Fall 2020). This module is written to compatible with OSRIC and other OSR games, and it is usable with most fantasy ruleset.
boardgame.rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: Aventuras de 1 Página: A Relíquia de Trutrutra
The Lost Relic of Trutrutra
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

1 page adventures is a serie of adventures to you adapt to any RPG system. A perfect plot to start a new campaing or to put in between of your adventures in the most different worlds!


Aventuras de 1 Página é uma séria para adaptar para em qualquer sistema. Um plot perfeito para começar a jogar ou colocar entre suas aventuras, nos mais diversos cenários e ambientações!
boardgame.rpgitemversion: The Lost Relic of Trutrutra PDF

boardgame.name: Mythic Champions of the Spheres
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Champions, your time has come! This companion book gives mythic support to characters who blend the Spheres of Power and Spheres of Might system together and includes:

Mythic class features for champion classes and prestige classes

New mythic feats

Powerful new mythic magical items

Rules for establishing and strengthening churches

Powers of faith for mythic characters ascending towards godhood

A newly-updated prestige class for truly epic casters

Mythic Champions of the Spheres completes the basic mythic trilogy for the Spheres systems, offering new powers and storytelling opportunities for characters ready to shake the world

boardgame.name: Bexim's Bazaar (Issue #21 - Sep 2020)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bexim’s Bazaar is a monthly gaming magazine dedicated to RPGs and wargames… and occasionally a boardgame of interest to RPG/wargamers. GMs and players will find plenty of resources such as magic item cards, random tables, mini-adventures, and articles related to gaming as well as printable props to hand out in game. This issue contains over 70 pages of gaming content for a variety of genres and games, and gamers are welcome to submit their own content for future issues (info on submitting is found inside each issue).

Here are the contents for Bexim's Bazaar Issue #20:


Bexim's Bazaar Pages


Growder’s Tent - each month, 4 new magic item cards

Treana’s Trinkets - d20 random list of trinkets each month

The Dented Helm - each month, 4 new adventure hooks

Hewbue’s Used Books - each month, 10-15 new book titles and authors

Racker’s Auction House - 6 new auction items with lore each month

Veach’s Spellbooks - each month, 2 new spellbooks with descriptions/cost

Dolbin’s Scrolls - 3 new magic scrolls to print and provide to players each month

The Mystic Baker - each month, a new menu prop to print and hand out to players

Wanted Poster - each month, a new Wanted Dead or Alive poster with an NPC

Deed - new printable prop each month related to owning property


The Skirmish Table Pages


Hazel’s Weapons Emporium - Seller of the best (unofficial) weapons and accessories for Gaslands

Temple Treasure - An unofficial scenario for the Relicblade skirmish wargame

The Survivor- An unofficial scenario for the Frostgrave skirmish wargame

Missile Strike! - An unofficial scenario for the Starbreach skirmish wargame

A New Node - An official scenario for Twisted skirmish wargame


GM Resources Pages


DM Scotty's Wandering Monster - A stat block and image for 5e creature

A Swift Survey - A 5e mini-adventure and hand-made map from Bryan Swift

Armored Assassins of Alorand - A 5e mini-adventure from AdventureaWeek.com

Kev’s Lounge Paper Miniatures - two paper miniatures to print and make for your game


The Crafting Table Pages


Chaos Portal - Craft Tutorial

Craft a Dice Tower - Craft Tutorial

Castle Winterhawk Papercraft - Papercraft project from Fat Dragon Games

Incorrigible IMPS - a monthly comic strip

boardgame.name: Marvel Battlegrounds
boardgame.description:
in Marvel Battlegrounds, each player is a team leader of heroes in epic conditions against villains who wish to control the Earth.

Six locations were invaded: New York, London, Los Angeles, Sokovia, Wakanda and Attilan.
Choose your leader: Iron Man, Captain America, Captain Marvel, Black Panther or Black Widow, once and enter each battlefield to end the villains' tyranny and expel them from the planet.

Leaders have three rounds to recruit heroes and fight villains. Each battle won brings rewards. Some of them provide the victory points you need to win the match, while others strengthen your team for the future to come.

Whoever has the most victory points at the end of the third round will win the game.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Adventures in the Misty Isles
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Take your fantasy adventures to a chain of islands filled with danger, intrigue, and excitement. For use with the Original Edition rules (First Edition/OD&D/0E) or an OSR equivalent (B/X recommended), this book compiles all three classic Wee Warriors™ Dungeon Kits into a single volume: Palace of the Vampire Queen (1976), The Dwarven Glory (1977), and The Misty Isles (1977).

The contents have been remastered for a clean print. This piece of gaming history is a must for collectors and old school gamers.

boardgame.name: Diceless Dungeons 2: The Diceless Wilds
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

It’s the long-awaited expansion to Diceless Dungeons!

Yes, diceless is leaving the dungeons, and it’s a whole new world out there! A world filled with new challenges and new things for your diceless characters to do:

Play non-human characters both ancient and powerful…

Learn new talents or wield new high sorcery…

Employ miniatures for visual spectacle…

Take on hirelings for a truly tactical experience…

Face an array of new monsters and new takes on old ones…

Make your combat more unpredictable than ever…

And uncover new artifacts, from the demonic to benign to saintly!

The Diceless Wilds greatly expands the game, both above and below ground, and allows for high and low fantasy settings. Diceless means the story comes first, but that personal decisions always matter. It’s the perfect blending of rules, rulings, and narrative, and The Diceless Wilds adds all of this to your old-school toolkit…

boardgame.name: Time Forgot
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

When the party joins a merchant company traveling to the remote island of Cebul, they get more than they bargained for. On the island they will encounter dinosaurs, fight bandits, meet tribes—both friendly and hostile—and uncover a relic that could rewrite their understanding of history.

Time Forgot is a beginning adventure supplement for Age of Ambition. It features a trading expedition scenario, and is designed to run between three and five gaming sessions.

boardgame.name: Mecha vs Kaiju (Cypher System)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Become a fearless mecha pilot in this anime-inspired role playing game powered by the Cypher System. Craft your character based on anime archetypes. Design giant robots with custom-made weapons, armor, and other exotic systems. Pit your players against monstrous kaiju capable of leveling cities. Get a taste of a world where every giant monster movie really happend.

This Mecha vs Kaiju supplement is a toolbox, keeping all the options in the background, in order to maintain Cypher's signature simplicity of gameplay. MvK features a number of new additions to the Cypher System:

Anime-inspired character Archetypes using combinations of Type, Flavor, and Ability.
Genre Rules for creating a variety of games at multiple power levels.
Options for how Scale affects the battlefield.
A complete Mecha and Kaiju Creation System, including numerous optional rules to match any style of play. Build giants like cyphers, vehicles, or go in depth with a point-based system capable of crafting any giant monster or robot you can imagine.
Sample mecha and kaiju, including the premier mecha team, Taskforce Ichiban, and the unstoppable Kaibutsu, King of the Kaiju!
Get a taste of the Mecha vs Kaiju setting, with a history of the world and organizations like the Mecha Assault Force, Ogre Ninja Clan, and Cult of the Beast God.

boardgame.name: Pack o' Dogs
boardgame.description:
Pack o’ Dogs is a quick 2-player card game featuring unique artwork of 40 dogs and 4 cats. Both players flip their cards over for simultaneous play. Form packs on the table with a hierarchy of determining which card is best when. The dogs form their packs with dogs of the same size, or dogs of neighboring sizes in the same color. Cats are unique, befriending the smallest and the largest dogs in their color, as well as other cats.

Pack o’ Dogs has two included versions in the rules: the Base Game and the Complex Game.

The Base Game has a little less strategy than the Complex Game so it is perfect for first time players, younger kids, or when you simply just want a faster more relaxed game. The scoring is based on the number of cards you have in your score pile and the game ends when you reach the bottom of the deck (no reshuffling the discard pile). The score pad is not used for this version.

The Complex Game requires more strategy than the Base Game. It involves planning out your moves, remembering what cards you know your opponent has, and which cards have already gone past to determine the best card to play. The game consists of a best of 7 rounds (i.e. first player to win 4 rounds ends the game, but doesn’t necessarily win the game). The score pad is used to write down your points for each round and tells you which rounds give you bonus points. You get bonus points for winning streaks and for winning the later rounds, so winning that final round could turn the whole game around!

Contents:
Deck of 45 Cards - 4 colors (white, red, black, yellow) of various sizes (numbers 1-10 and a cat, for each color), and 1 treat card
6 Reference Cards - 3 for each player for quick rule reminders
1 Score Pad - 20 sheets with 3 games per sheet (60 games total)
1 Rule Sheet

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Medusaborn
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The medusaborn are a cursed race for 5th Edition D&d.

The medusaborn are a race who inherited the medusa's curse from their parents, by one of many means. They do not carry the same image of their parents, but instead the curse is diluted and forms in one of two unique forms that represent the opposing natures of a medusa. Ever-beautiful as the medusa's blessing implies, the medusaborn are elegant in their monstrosity. The two forms, the eurydale and stheno, result from different circumstances of their birth.

This document contains the full race, descriptions of their tendencies, beliefs and social structures, the nature of their birth and relationship with their nature as the result of a medusa's curse and circumstances they may find themselves in. Furthurmore, it outlines the cults of personality that a medusa may construct from medusaborn who share its curse and the stat blocks for six NPCs related to such a cult.

The NPC stat blocks featured are

Eurydale Attendant (CR 1/2)
Eurydale Cultist (CR 1/2)
Eurydale Knifewinder (CR 8)
Euryale Stoneguardian (CR 9)
Stheno Perfect Child (CR 1/8)
Stheno Mage (CR 7)
The medusaborn race is a strong choice for playing a character who struggles with a sense of belonging, and wants to seek more. They are prone to vanity and pride, but simultaneously know to combat those qualities within themselves. Medusaborn are always outsiders even among their own kind. If you're looking to play a character who seeks wisdom outside themselves to battle their obsessive self-serving impulses or seek to outgrow a cursed parentage then this is a race you should consider!

boardgame.name: Gang Guide #02: The Nicotines
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The NICOTINES have a long-standing reputation among super-powered criminals as one of the most reliable and reasonably priced groups of henchmen in world. Despite a lengthy history and having more than a few gimmicks up their sleeves these days, they are still basically just that same lovable bunch of young street punks with a chip on their shoulder.

"GANG GUIDE #02: The NICOTINES" contains a briefing from Vigil (the paranormal head of the U.S. Department of Superhero Affairs), tables of character stats for the Nicotines in V&V® 2.1 and 3.0/MIGHTY PROTECTORS®, background, personality traits, and tactics!

boardgame.name: Mission Packet 2: Subversion
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Sprawl is built around missions and the Corporations have no shortage of dirty money but if you want to take the fight to them that means subverting their goals, one directive at a time.

Within this Mission Packet you will find three non-Corporate factions struggling to fight against the system, a custom move for subverting the goals of the Corporations from the inside and missions for each faction for once you have earned their trust. The Factions introduced in this Mission Packet are:

The Synth Republic, who seek to rescue captured AI from the hands of their Corporate masters and provide them the opportunity to experience life in the physical domain.

The Peoples Union, local gang or the last protectors of labour rights? When they offer you the chance to wipe the debt of thousands of workers from the system will you step up to protect the downtrodden?

The Env, anti-capitalist environmental activists pushed to take extreme measures in their fight to protect what little is left of the natural world.

boardgame.name: Word Hustle
boardgame.description:
Can you arrange your letter tiles to make the highest-scoring crossword grid?

In Word Hustle, after a letter draft during setup, you'll press your luck and roll your dice to gain more letter tiles. Then, you’ll race against others to make a high-scoring crossword grid. Over three rounds, you’ll try to maximize the scoring power of your personal letter set to win. Word games like Word Hustle – that let you move your letters around to find words – are incredibly satisfying.

In this word game, you won't be sitting idly waiting for your turn. There's simultaneous word-building and player interaction in each phase – you can steal or share letters and make strategic moves to win.

Word Hustle’s unique challenge of having to make new and better words with the same letters each round means the game gets MORE and MORE exciting. It turns out, the human brain loves this challenge. Word Hustle will lead you to consider moves like:

• Should I steal that valuable tile or go for more tiles for myself?
• Should I make words quickly and put pressure on my opponents or take my time and make high-scoring words?
• Can I outscore my previous round using the same letters but new words?

The player with the most points after three rounds is the winner, unless they are challenged to an Ultimate Hustle! In the optional Ultimate Hustle, the winner hands over their letter set to see if their final round score can be outdone… But, it won't be easy – the challenger only has two minutes and can’t use any of the words the winner used in the game.

boardgame.name: Building the Shadows: A Film Noir Mission Generator
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

So lemme get this straight: you birds and dames are sittin’ around bored because no work is comin’ your way? Then get out and make some work! Just download yourself a copy of Building the Shadows: A Film Noir Mission Generator, grab some six-sided freckled cubes and start rollin’ on the tables. In just a few minutes, you could be puttin’ fresh slugs in your Roscoes and headin’ out on any one of over 90,000 different jobs, with no two jobs going the same way twice. And don’t let the cover make you into a patsy — it says it’s for Midnight Boulevard, but you can use it with any film noir game. You can even use it in other genres if you tinker with it right, savvy?

So now you know what to do. Building the Shadows lets you make the job; how it does down is up to you and your pals. Get outta here before some hatchetmen come and plug you!

boardgame.name: The Veil
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

When the pals accept a job from a once-elegant woman wearing a veil, they begin a journey into the depths of the city and the blacker depths of the human soul. As they close in on their target, they’re unaware that darkness is also closing in on them, and just might claim them on its way to fulfilling a dire mission of its own.

The Veil is a short adventure for Midnight Boulevard: 2D6 Adventure in the World of Film Noir, which uses the rules for the Traveller SRD. The adventure is also usable with Cepheus Engine and the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game.

boardgame.name: Fiveaside: Football Card Game
boardgame.description:
The 'beautiful game' in beautiful 8-bit design.
Based on the '5-a-side' format of the game played all over the world, the ambition was to create a fun, fast and nostalgic game for football (soccer) 'heads' - featuring cult players from recent years in 8-bit style.

We're football fans first and foremost, coupled with a love for classic video games and re-emergence of the retro gaming scene, the combination of a football card game with 8-bit influence felt like a fantastic combination - with ALL ORIGINAL ARTWORK. We wanted to produce something different than a standard tuck box of suited cards and also steer away from the classic 'trumps' format - although good for sports stats, there isn't much variety and this needed to be more original.

In short, you try and build your best 5-a-side team from a deck of current and classic players and score goals/points by having the team that totals the most stars at 'Kick-off'. More on mechanic and rules below.

Gameplay summary:
You are dealt 5 cards each
players take turns to draw a player card, then a referee card
the aim is to build a legitimate formation of GK DF MF MF ST, at that point you can initiate a Kick-Off, where all players
lay their cards down and the player with the most stars total scores a goal, first to 5 goals wins. But the Referee cards are designed to make that tricky and fun!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: As You 'Wich
boardgame.description:
A delicious (and sometimes disgusting) card game that has one goal, build the best sandwich you can and convince your opponents it's the best they've ever seen. As You 'Wich is an ecstatic celebration of mankind's greatest invention: the sandwich. From hot pitas stuffed with falafel to fresh baguettes with ham and butter, every corner of the world has its sandwich, and its people have their sandwich opinions.

Each player starts with 5 cards. Players then draw cards or take from the three piles of cards in the middle (known as “The Sandwich Store”). Gameplay continues until each store is forcefully closed. Then players take turns to pitch their creation.

Once all sandwiches have been pitched, on the count of three, players point and pick the best sandwich. The best sandwich wins the round. The chef who wins the most rounds wins the game!

boardgame.name: Freelance Traveller (Issue 101 - Sep/Oct 2020)
boardgame.description:
From the contents page:

Freelance Traveller #101: Sept/Oct 2020

Freelance Traveller is published bimonthly in PDF form by the editor. The current issue (and all back issues) can be found on Freelance Traveller’s website, http://www.freelancetraveller.com.
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: Active Measures: The Sons of Rudurgu
Doing It My Way: Classification Societies in Traveller
Kurishdam: The Aesirist Cult: Religion in the Sacnoth Dominate
Multimedia Gallery: Twilight Stories #1: Port of Transit
The Prep Room: Designer's Notes: Virtual Traveller: A Weekend of Virus-free Online Roleplaying
The Prep Room: Finding Your Way Around the Starport
Raconteurs' Rest: Smoke Test: Once In A Blue Moon

boardgame.name: Book of Lost Arcana Vol. II
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

From ages long past, the Book of Lost Arcana vol 2 adds even more spells to the Raven of the Scythe fantasy role playing game, perfect for game masters looking to surprise the players or for wizards looking to delve deep into powerful magic long forgotten.

Also, includes rules for making powerful and unique artifacts.

The Book of Lost Arcana volume 2 is sure to add a new dimension to the scope of magic in Raven of the Scythe.
boardgame.rpg: Raven of the Scythe Fantasy Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: A Dead Man's Guide to Dragongrin
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Absolute Tabletop is proud to present: A Dead Man’s Guide to Dragongrin – a campaign setting guide and worldbuilding toolkit for forging your own dark fantasy realm.

Fully compatible with 5e, A Dead Man’s Guide to Dragongrin includes extensive setting background and mythos, unique regions and cultures, new player options and mechanics, and a host of inspirational tools and creative techniques for building your own version of this twisted, troubled world.

Evil reigns in the realm of Dragongrin. The Dismembered Lord extends his reach and the free lands kneel before his shadow. But his dark forces do not march unopposed. There are those who do the impossible in Dragongrin. Some call them fools, traitors, troublemakers – others call them heroes. You are those heroes, and this is the book you need to forge your legend.

A Dead Man’s Guide to Dragongrin is an atlas of inspiration. This robust campaign setting guide brims with the unique lore and rich history of the world of Dragongrin. Also included are customizable options and prep tools, making this a truly modular worldbuilding toolkit. Discover the dark fantasy realm of Dragongrin, learn of its troubles and conflicts, and then make it uniquely yours, bringing it to life at your game table.

A Dead Man’s Guide to Dragongrin is 472 pages. This is a monstrous book, jam-packed with usable content.

A Dead Man’s Guide to Dragongrin includes:

Life in Dragongrin – Discover the dark fantasy world of Dragongrin. Learn the history of the world, meet the important figures, and dive into the lore and culture of this unique realm.

Character Creation – Heroes aren’t welcome, but you’ve got what it takes to be the exception. Forge your character using inspiring tables and worldly lore.

Heritages (7 new race options, 5e compatible) - Replacing standard race options in 5e, heritages offer new and flexible character creation options. Choose from a list of mechanical options to express how your character is unique.

Cultures (11 new subrace options, 5e Compatible) - Replacing the subrace options in 5e with cultures (but yielding similar mechanical results), any heritage can be matched with any culture creating virtually endless options. Choose from a list of mechanical options to express how your character fits within their culture.

New Backgrounds (29 new options, 5e compatible) – Over two dozeen unique backgrounds that include thematic roll tables and new background features to craft your own custom character.

New Subclasses (24 new options, 5e compatible) – Find two dozen brand new subclasses (two for each core class), fully unique to Dragongrin all with new mechanics

Class Guides - Dragongrin is a unique world, and each 5e class fits into its own distinct place within it. Each of the twelve core classes from 5e has its own detailed guide of how they fit into the world.

Feats and Spells (5e compatible) – Expand your character with new feats and arcane powers, including those of the volatile Bleak.

Character Depth – Dragongrin is filled with unique figures, and your characters are no different. Give them a history, family, and something worth fighting for in a grim world.
Custom Character Sheet – This three page character sheet is fully customized for Dragongrin, and includes places for all of the character creation options in the book as well the addition of tracking character subsystems (such as Infamy).
Dominions of Ash – Discover eleven regions of Dragongrin, each brimming with NPCs to meet, locations to explore, and missions to undertake. Each Dominion of Ash includes two ready-made adventures.

Darkness of Dragongrin – New subsystems such as brutal combat, treacherous travel, and gaining notorious infamy among the factions of the world come included here.

Wonders of Dragongrin – Explore the ancient war between the legendary Titans and Primordials, and uncover their hidden relics beneath the surface of Dragongrin. Unravel the mysteries of the arcane maelstrom known as the Bleak, and learn how the Dismembered Legion keeps it hold on a fractured realm.

Monstrum Auturnum – Pit heroes against a dozen varieties of armored Marrow, or unleash the mighty Behemoths of the Bleak upon the world. Each enemy includes a 5e-compatible statblock.

The Dismembered Lord – Encounter the tyrannical ruler of Dragongrin. Learn the history of this iconic figure, and pit heroes against two combat forms, both human and monstrous. Also included is a full section describing the Dismembered Lord's fortress, the Spire of Knowing, allowing you to force the adventurers to fight their way through the mulit-level tower before facing the Sovereign.

boardgame.name: A Dead Man's Guide to Dragongrin: Character Creation Kit
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is composed of portions of our complete campaign setting guide, A Dead Man’s Guide to Dragongrin.

A Dead Man’s Guide to Dragongrin – Character Creation Kit gives you the core, basic information you’ll need to create a character for the dark realm of Dragongrin.

This free product includes all of the heritages and cultures in Dragongrin, as well as a quick-start character creation guide, and a world primer.

In A Dead Man’s Guide to Dragongrin. combining heritage and culture yields a character similar in mechanics and balance to a standard 5e race and subrace. This subsystem is fully compatible with standard 5e backgrounds and character classes. Heritage acts similarly to race, while culture acts similarly to subrace.

Life in Dragongrin – Discover the dark fantasy world of Dragongrin. Learn the history of the world, meet the important figures, and dive into the lore and culture of this unique realm.

Character Creation – Heroes aren’t welcome, but you’ve got what it takes to be the exception. Forge your character using inspiring tables and worldly lore.

Heritages (7 new race options, 5e compatible) - Replacing standard race options in 5e, heritages offer new and flexible character creation options. Choose from a list of mechanical options to express how your character is unique.

Cultures (11 new subrace options, 5e Compatible) - Replacing the subrace options in 5e with cultures (but yielding similar mechanical results), any heritage can be matched with any culture creating virtually endless options. Choose from a list of mechanical options to express how your character fits within their culture.

boardgame.name: Battlefield: Space
boardgame.description: The third game in the "Battlefield" series expands the game to the stars. Each of two players has a deck of 72 cards which represent an alliance of space fleets from several alien races. The two sides differ in the fleets and their capabilities, but the forces are equal in their effectiveness through combinations of powers and tactics. Deploy your warships to the battle coordinates, assign your available reinforcements, and deal with the anomalies that can occur in the depths of space. Winners go on to fight in future encounters, while the losers are blown to oblivion. Through a series of skirmishes, each space force will be reduced to their most powerful fleets, and will finally meet in a glorious battle for supremacy in the galaxy!

boardgame.name: For the Girls
boardgame.description:
Hey girl hey. Ditch the dudes for the night because this game is For The Girls! In this adult party game by What Do You Meme?, picture grown up, hilarious, original spins on sleepover classics. You’ll cry with laughter as you find out which of your friends:


Dares to prank an ex or reveal their most embarrassing secret
Has (or has never) participated in an embarrassing fad
Is the most likely to choose chicken nuggets over sex
Has the hottest dad
Or can name the most female rappers in a rapid fire round.


This game is perfect for bachelorette parties, girls night in (or out), sororities and reunions, birthday parties and more. Consider it your pregame essential.

Includes 500 cards and a die.

Adults only: This game is intended for ages 17+ and contains mature language and references. NOT intended for children — trust us on this one.

boardgame.name: Cave Evil: Warlords Metal Miniatures
boardgame.description:
Handcrafted metal miniatures that replace the warlord tokens

Manuel Ingeland has crafted a VERY limited amount of hand sculpted, cast and finished minis for both Cave Evil and Warcults. They are EXTREMELY limited (20 sets of each) and expensive due to the hand labor involved in the process.

boardgame.name: Cave Evil: Endgame Miniatures
boardgame.description:
Handcrafted metal miniatures that replace the endgame tokens

Manuel Ingeland has crafted a VERY limited amount of hand sculpted, cast and finished minis for each Cave Evil endgame event.

boardgame.name: Cave Evil: Warcults – Leather Counters
boardgame.description: Handcrafted by Leather Craftsmen Micheal Kerr, leather Counters of Warlord, Comanders I,II and III, and Necromancer. 5 Counters in four different colors Red, Yellow, Purple and Gray 20 total.

boardgame.name: Split Second: Solitaire Firefights Against The Clock
boardgame.description:
Split Second is a card-based wargame where the player controls a team of soldiers referred to as Operators in special operations and SWAT-style missions involving violent resolutions.
The game is played using cards to represent the physical components of the battlespace, dice to resolve actions with uncertain outcomes, tokens for recording some effects, and a timer to apply pressure to the player's decision-making process.

The player chooses a Mission from the Mission Dossier, which will include a roster of cards that represent the environment with pieces of cover, doors, and other elements referred to as Props as well as cards representing the opposition referred to as Hostiles. These cards are combined into small decks in a manner that uses randomization and fixed elements to form an Encounter. The same Encounter can play out differently each time it is played because of the randomization of the cards, forcing the player to think on their feet and adapt to changing circumstances. This also makes each scenario highly replayable.

Unlike most games that use a board with spaces or miniatures on a playing surface, in Split Second the playing area is abstracted using cards to represent the battlefield.
Ranges aren't measured in physical distance, but instead cards are placed into Areas that are split up by Area Divider cards.
Movement between objects isn't made in any linear measurement, but in movement points as the combatants anchor themselves to and then move away from objects in the battlezone.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Union Station
boardgame.description:
From the turn of the 20th century, Chicago's Union Station rose to prominence as one of the busiest and most used train station hubs in the United States. At one point, five railroad companies each owned stock in the Chicago Union Station Co, collaborating to build the greatest train station at the time.

Union Station is a quick-playing cube rails game, focusing more on share purchasing and stock manipulation than route building. On your turn you may either buy stock and increase its value, sell all of your stock to get quick cash while also lowering the company's value, or lay track. While the shares might come out randomly, it's all about careful timing and the willingness to drop something good for something even better.

The game ends immediately when all of the Shares have been bought or sold off, 20 dividends have been paid, or railroad companies cannot lay any additional track. The players add together their cash in hand to the value of each of their shares, and the player with the most money wins.

-description from designer
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: Union Station discussion with the designer Travis Hill

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes:
NEW! Kickstarter
+Shipping
PayPal and Venmo payment preferred.
Brand new copy from Kickstarter (which wasn't shrink wrapped).
The game is complete and everything looks good.

boardgame.name: American Truck Simulator - Idaho
boardgame.description:
Welcome to Idaho, a land of rugged beauty that is home to millions of acres of wilderness and a landscape that ranges from desert to fertile farms. Best known for its world famous potatoes, Idaho offers drivers the opportunity to get involved with some of the States' largest economies such as farming and timber harvesting.

Visit Boise, the state's capital city with a vibrant urban center found in the heart of the Treasure Valley or experience an out-of-this-world view at the Craters of the Moon National Monument; Idaho offers its visitors endless natural beauty and landmarks to explore.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Feudal Patrol
Feudal Patrol: Skirmish Miniature Gaming in Ancient, Medieval & Fantasy Periods
boardgame.description:
Skirmish Miniature Gaming in Ancient, Medieval & Fantasy Periods.

- Covers all prefirearm period from cavemen to pike men plus fantasy!
- Use any figures / any single basing / any scale
- Games use 20 to 50 figures per side and plays in 2 to 3 hours
- Designed for solo, 2 player, and team play
- Double random activation provides for fog of war, drama and unpredictability
- Streamlined, intuitive combat resolution using a unique card based system eliminates cross referencing charts and tables
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Civilizations Collide: The Wars of the Aztecs, the Inca, the Maya, and the Conquistadores – A Supplement for Feudal Patrol

boardgame.name: Smoke and Oakum
boardgame.description:
Smoke and Oakum expands on the rules for Sky Ships and Sailing. Including new rules for Conditions, Weather, Crew, Chases, and a host of other options to bring character and depth to life as a Corsair sailing the skies of the Molten Seas!

Smoke and Oakum is a supplement for the Corsairs RPG. A copy of the Core Rules is needed for play.

boardgame.name: Commissioned: The Call
boardgame.description:
This is the first formal expansion to the base game Commissioned.

The Call explores the reality of broken people working and living together inside the church.

The Call includes 2 new Apostles, 2 new Scenarios, 9 Trials, a Solo Play Mode, and a Chain Module to deepen the deck-building & player interactions in the base game.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Movie Plotz
boardgame.description:
This is a ONE CARD version of Movie Plotz, conveniently printed on plastic so that you can put it in your wallet! It's the size of a credit card and offers the Movie Plotz experience in an even smaller footprint.

—description from the publisher


Movie Plotz is a wild game that allows your group to create hilarious fake movie storylines, then pitch them out loud for maximum laughs. Movie Plotz was designed as a very effective team building event that has evolved into a crazy party game where everyone contributes to the fun.

Players begin with a simple plot (a simple sentence) then choose a challenge/modifier from a list (instead of a card) to modify the movie concept. With each change, players get to redo the pitch and make it even more exciting. In the end, the final plot will be a guaranteed hit!

Depending on the rules variation that you choose to play, the player with the most points will win.

boardgame.name: Iron Pirate: The Swashbuckling Train Race
boardgame.description:
Iron Pirate - The Swashbuckling Train Race is a worker placement, race against the board, semi co-operative game that plays 2-4 (Solo mode being investigated) in approximately 45-90 minutes.

Gather resources from the sea locked islands by sailing the Njall Sea. But watch out for those pesky pirates looking to steal your hard earned resources. Try your luck at "Liars Dice" in the Tavern and walk away with a handful of coins, or maybe you might lose?

Fancy fighting those pirates? Why not buy yourself a cannon or two to upgrade your ship before blasting them out of the water

Work together to complete the track before Watkins Railway or face losing out on that big contract.....

All this, and more, in Iron Pirate - The Swashbuckling Train Race

On your turn, you must first place a worker (Phase 1) on an available slot (In the first round, this will only be the mainland). Each player places one worker each in turn before repeating again. In round 1, you start with 2 workers each.
Do you try your hand in the tavern to gain coins? Do you go to market to buy resources? Do you upgrade your ship at the shipwright? Do you load your worker onto your ship

Once all workers are placed, any one who has boarded their ship may now sail their ship the relevant number of spaces (after round 1, this will only be 1 space as upgrades do not take effect until the end of the round). Each player who is on a ship will state which number sea region they wish to move to and then activate the pirate deck the required number of times dealing with any action points on the card(s).

Phase 3 is where workers return back to your player boards

Phase 4 is where your ships are upgraded, more pirates are added to the board and the round marker moves along

The game ends after 10 rounds and the player with the most points wins. However, if the board wins, I.E, if you don't complete the railway before the board does, then you are only playing for pride.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Massive Darkness: Doors & Bridges
boardgame.description: Box contains 15 doors (5 pieces in each of 3 types) and 2 bridges.

boardgame.name: Massive Darkness 2: Hellscape 3D Pack
boardgame.description:
A set of miniatures to replace cardboard tokens in Massive Darkness 2: Hellscape.

This pack contains:

4 Portals
4 Fountains
4 Forges
4 Bear Traps
6 Spike Traps

boardgame.name: Massive Darkness 2: Doors & Bridges 3D Pack
boardgame.description:
A set of miniatures to replace cardboard tokens in Massive Darkness 2: Hellscape.

This pack contains:

15 Doors (in 3 different sculpts)
2 Bridges

boardgame.name: Massive Darkness 2: Chests & Pillars 3D Pack
boardgame.description:
A set of miniatures to replace cardboard tokens in Massive Darkness 2: Hellscape.

This pack contains:

15 Common Chests
4 Special Chests
6 Pillars

boardgame.name: Taiping Era: Commanders
boardgame.description:
This booklet is a supplement to Taiping Era.

It contains the commander cards for all of the commanders in Taiping Era, plus extras such as "Chinese" Gordon, the Commanders of British forces in the 1840 Opium War, as well as blanks for players to create their own.

“Taiping Era” is a set of wargame rules for fighting land battles in the turbulent middle years of the 19th century.
Commanders are represented in the game by a model figure, as in most tabletop wargames. However, each commander can have unique abilities, so that he performs differently on the battlefield to all other commanders.
Commanders are allocated at both Army and Divisional level and their abilities are adjusted to take their relative levels of seniority into account.
The Commander’s abilities can be summarised on small cards, to be placed with the figure or held at the back of the board for reference. Cards for many of the armies covered by the rules are given in this small document, together with blanks for the user to complete themselves.

—description from the publisher and rulebook
boardgame.boardgamefamily: History: Opium Wars and Taiping Rebellion
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Taiping Era: Tabletop Wargame Rules for Land Conflict in 19th Century China

boardgame.name: M.U.C.S. - Multi Universal Combat System and RPG
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a nearly Generic Universal Role-Playing Game System of Mayhem and Destruction. No RPG system is easier to learn than MUCS. This game system is set in a futuristic world called Nearth. Nearth's cities what few there are in the Civilized Lands, are very dangerous, filled with bright neon lights at night and street gangs waging war on the city's night patrols. Tall metal sky scrapers pack thousands of people in small confined spaces. With a complete view of the Uncivilized Lands, any new character created there will have a chance to create and customize their own vehicle. All of what you have just read is being controlled by a few power hungry people called Power Barons, rich and powerful men, who are uncivilized beyond belief. Think of this RPG as Road Warrior meets a Fantasy World, then intermingle the two, then you have MUCS.
boardgame.rpg: M.U.C.S. - Multi Universal Combat System and RPG

boardgame.name: Flock of Sheep
boardgame.description:
Ages 6+

A game where sheep leave their pen and then flock together. Your goal is to end up with the most sheep of your color.

There are 12 2x2unit tiles (called "sheep") comprising 2 sets of reversible tiles with black sheep on one side and white sheep on the other, having Black: White ratios of {6:1, 5:2, 4:3, 3:4, 2:5, 1:6).

One set black-up is randomly mixed with the other set white-up and then randomly dealt out in a ring enclosing the 9 central points of a go board, forming a pen.

Movement
On a turn, Sheep always move a distance of exactly 5, and if not forming a flock, they then flip over. They are allowed one change of direction per move.

The game has two phases: 1) Dispersing from the pen, 2) Flocking together.

1) Dispersing from the pen,
During the Dispersing phase, priority is given to moving sheep that have the most length of shared edges. The sheep must move to reduce the total length of connections, and the number of touching corners. The Dispersing phase ends when no sheep are touching each other.

2) Flocking together.
During this phase, the sheep may move next to one another. When they end up sharing more than a corner with other friendly sheep, they form a flock and are not required to complete the turn with is flip. Flocked sheep no longer move and may not be flipped.

It is not allowed to repeat board positions during play (for example by returning a piece that the other player just moved)

The game ends when all the sheep are in Flocks.

Note: Many thanks to Dale Walton for all of his suggestions and concise wording of the rules.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Codex Celtarum (2nd Edition)
Codex Celtarum 2nd Printing
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Celts dwelt in a world wholly separate from our own - of stone cromlech, wicker men, dark fey and wild gods. In their world, ancient trees bore the wisdom of time, and the world was alive with spirits. They possessed a language of such haunting beauty that its echoes stir memories within us of a people we once were. The Codex Celtarum delves into the myths of the Celtic peoples, the powers of the world around them, the monsters that hunted them, and the gods that watched over them.

Within the Codex Celtarum lies a wealth of information; gaming material that blows new life into the world of the fey, the druid, the ranger and all characters whose travels carry them through the wooded hills, broken crags and dark forests of our primeval imaginings.

boardgame.name: Duckie Delight
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Duckie Delight is a stretch goal for the Lucky Ducks in a Row Kickstarter.

boardgame.name: Ex Umbra
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ex Umbra is a playable dungeon-generator to construct fictional underground caves, labyrinths and tombs. This physical print-and-play game can be played alone or with up to 3 friends. Playtime ranges from 1 to 4 hours.

Meet with your friends and collaboratively draw the map of your dungeon as you collect questionable rumors about its threats and treasures.

Ex Umbra is a generator that is fun to play and creates maps that are useful for further creative use. For example in narrative endeavors or as preparation for pen and paper role-playing games.

Playing Ex Umbra
You (and up to three friends) sit around a campfire, in a rowdy tavern or right outside the dungeon entrance. You’re huddled over a parchment, telling the stories and rumors you heard of this dangerous underground lair. Together you will try to reconstruct it from the unreliable information available to you.

In Ex Umbra you will play Dungeon Cards and make sense of how they relate to the dangerous forces of the dungeon. Together you will draw the collaborative map of the dungeon and see it slowly take shape. In the end you will have built an interesting fictional place with its unique threats and rewards.



Play Overview

This is the sequence of phases and turns that make up a game of Ex Umbra:

Play begins with a brief discussion phase. This provides space for all players to share their assumptions and expectations.

Next is the planning phase. Here you will determine the dungeon’s Size and Difficulty and the dangers that lurk within.

Followed by the foundation phase. You start putting marks to paper and shaping the dungeon, its entrance and heart. This will generate an interesting starting situation for the rest of the game.

After this you move into the heart of the game: The discovery phase.

This contains a number of exploration turns based on the dungeon’s Size. In each of these the active player plays Dungeon Cards, makes sense of the results and draws the architecture of the dungeon. You will gain and spend tokens to reveal and detail Threats and Rewards.

Halfway through discovery you take two special turns: In the tremor turn you’ll discover a large-scale change to the dungeon. Then you’ll move into the heart turn. It is similar to the exploration turns but collaborative and focused on the dungeon’s heart. Afterwards you’ll finish the remainder of your exploration turns.

The final phase is the cleanup phase. Here you’ll tie off loose ends and add your finishing touches.

boardgame.name: Cracker Games: The Imp Box
boardgame.description:
One giant cracker. Six brilliant games.

Six family games in a giant twist-end cracker. Gorgeous, high quality components and completely plastic-free. Reusable, re-playable and highly innovative.

A perfect addition to your Christmas table.


In IMPulsive, you vote tactically to win cubes from your opponents while keeping your own safe.
In IMPressive, you’re trying to collect sets of imps by choosing from a line up of available cards with ascending costs.
In IMPetuous, speed is of the essence. Flip cards, spot matches and gain points.
In IMPatient, you are subtly trying to influence the outcome of an imp race.
In IMPrudent, you need cubes and you need cards, but each turn you have to prioritise.
In IMPassive, your aim is to manipulate the value of imps while ending up with the highest scoring cards.



But there’s no need to stop there. The cracker game components also form a neat little kit for families who’d like to get started in game design.

The Cracker Games also come with six puzzles, a board game design challenge booklet and six terrible jokes.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Potion-Making (Gift Edition)
Зельеварение: Подарочное издание
boardgame.description:
This Gift Edition includes Practice, University Course and Guild of Alchemists. In addition, in the box there are also bonus materials that are absent in the regular editions of the game: the Alchemikote creature card and alternative sequences for creating the Philosopher's Stone for the Alchemists Guild.


In the card game Potion-Making: Practice, players take on the roles of apprentice mages studying in a Magic School. Each player tries to gather the necessary components in order to produce magic elixirs, powders, talismans and even magical creatures. For each completed creation the player scores points – and the harder the task, the more points a player scores.

The deck consists of 76 cards, with each card featuring one of 16 elements on its bottom half and a magic formula or spell on its top half. Each player start the game with four cards in hand, and four cards are laid face-up in the "Desk of Elements"; players can use these public elements to complete a formula in hand.

On a turn, a player draws until he has five cards in hand, then he plays one or more cards from his hand. He can:


Discard a card onto the Desk of Elements; he scores one point if that element is not currently present on the Desk.
Take elements on the Desk to complete a formula on a card in his hand. He scores points equal to the number shown on the formula, then places the element cards face-down over the bottom half of the card so that all players can see the formula. His turn then ends.
Use one or more previously completed formulas, along with any elements required and available on the Desk, to complete a more difficult formula. He can use formulas in front of himself or other players to do this. Any elements under formulas reused this way are returned to the Desk. Any opponent who loses one or more formulas this way scores half the points of the more difficult formula just completed. The player's turn then ends.
Plays a spell from his hand to take a card from the desk into his hand, to decompose one completed formula or to transform one formula into another. After playing a spell, he must take another action, which could be playing another spell.


After the deck runs out, players continue to take turns until no one has cards remaining in hand. The player with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: Necromunda: Underhive – Corpse Grinder Gang Dice
boardgame.description:
Show your dedication to the Lord of Skin and Sinew with this special Corpse Grinder Cult-themed dice set. The eight 16mm dice are red with a marbled effect and feature a bone coloured in-fill on the numbers and symbols.

This set contains

3 Six-sided dice with Corpse Grinder logo on the '6'
2 Necromunda Ammo dice
2 Necromunda Injury dice
1 Necromunda Scatter dice


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Battlelords of the 23rd Century Conversion Guide
boardgame.description:
Prior Editions to Kickstarter Edition

From the introduction:

Free downloadable conversion guidelines to adapt characters, armor, and weapons from prior editions (1st - 6th) of the Battlelords game for the newest edition of the Battlelords of the 23rd Century roleplaying game.

boardgame.name: Martial Archetype - Aberrant Jester
boardgame.description:
"Wanting to dabble in the art of poetic tomfoolery while also being proficient with a blade? Now's your chance!

The Aberrant Jester is a martial archetype designed for players seeking to mystify their allies and enemies with near misses, prop comedy, and a presence that is sure to enrapture all who you deem worthy. While your hits might not land as hard as others, your bravado and laughter is sure to keep you in the midst of any fight till the bloody (or hilarious) end. Take a chance, be a jester, and make the world your own with a florish and a jab!"

(Author Summary)

boardgame.name: Carbon City Zero: World Edition
boardgame.description:
The planet is in a climate crisis. For decades governments have ignored it. Now it’s up to a group of city mayors to sort it.

Carbon City Zero: World Edition is a race against the clock, where players juggle their common goal (of collective survival) with local priorities. And that’s just the start of it. From how people get from A to B, to what powers their cup of tea, every decision is a climate decision. These mayors have their work cut out for them - will they avoid climate chaos?

Carbon City Zero: World Edition is a revised second edition of the climate action game Carbon City Zero. This edition is a collaborative deck-building game for 1-4 people in which players develop a sustainable city by greening transport, transforming industries, getting citizens on board, and showing world leaders how it’s done. Each player starts with an identical deck, buying additional cards from a shared marketplace to create a more sustainable city. But you need to negotiate, working together with cities around the world. Balancing the need to generate income with reducing carbon, players can follow numerous paths to victory, but collaboration is key. You’ll need to bring together governments, industries, and the public. And if you can’t bring carbon levels to zero before it’s too late - we all lose. The stakes couldn’t be higher.

The game also comes with the original rules for competitive and solo play.

In the collaborative and solo modes players win if they can bring the carbon level to zero in eight rounds or less, while in competitive games it's a race to zero - first there wins!

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Warhammer Quest: Blackstone Fortress – Blessed Aquila Promo Card
Warhammer Quest: Blackstone Fortress – Gesegneter Aquila Promo Karte
boardgame.description:
Blessed Aquila is a promo card that came with December 2018 White Dwarf issue.

Type: Ministorum Artefact

Effect: Once per exploration round, exhaust this card in the same manner as a resource card to re-roll 1 activation or action dice. This card does not turn face up at the start of the next turn. Instead, it is turned face up at the end of that exploration round.

boardgame.name: Takenoko: Chibis – Giant Alternate Miniature
boardgame.description: Giant sized Chibis figures for all the cute baby characters in Takenoko Giant: Chibis. These figures are sold individually and each replaces the matching wooden token in the box. Figures are approximately 5cm tall.

boardgame.name: BUNGEE
boardgame.description:
Bungee is a patented dexterity game for homes, bars and pubs. Inspired by human-sand timers, darts, pong, dice and more, Bungee games allow you to relax with friends and family, while enjoying shared-sporty suspense!

Players aim to score points or gain important game tokens. Win conditions vary based on the rule set players select.

Bungee is a dexterity component with endless possibilities.

Try it and see what game bounces back at you!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Bat Out of Hell
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This module is designed for 6-8 characters with 10,000 experience points or less, and will take 4 hours maximum. The party should contain someone with computer skills.
...
You have been hired by SSDC, Space Systems Development Corporation, and have signed away 6 years of your life to their service. Your new boss, a Human by the name of Izeah Blackman, calls you in to the meeting room. He is a 6-foot tall black man, wearing a shirt and a tie-dyed tie with swirling yellow, red, and orange colors. He turns to your group.

User summary:

The last page of the document is an oversize, print-and-play, scenario map.
boardgame.rpg: Battlelords of the Twenty-Third Century (5th & 6th Editions)

boardgame.name: Silent Wars: Tales of the Rebellion
boardgame.description:
The Battlelords' Rebel Sourcebook

User summary:

This item starts with a lengthy in-universe fiction, and then presents game data - primarily, an alternate campaign setting in which the characters oppose the Alliance and its influence.
boardgame.rpg: Battlelords of the Twenty-Third Century (5th & 6th Editions)

boardgame.name: Shade Hunter
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A 2nd-level adventure for DCC RPG.

In modern, sorcery-noir, “Nowhere City,” your adventurers investigate a crime spree by perpetrators who are identical to their victims!

Shade Hunter is a Blade Runner-inspired adventure that throws your 2nd-level Nowhere City Nights PCs into the investigation a spate of violent crimes with an odd twist: eyewitnesses swear that the perpetrators of the crimes could be the identical twins of their victims!

Someone, or something, is behind it all, but this is Nowhere City – so the list of possible suspects is endless. The city has so many corrupt politicians, greedy corporations and crooked cops that it’s rotted through. And operating in secret, behind it all, are the sorcerer cults that control the rest of the scum as if they were pawns on a chessboard. Do your PCs have the guns and the guts to get to the bottom of things? Secret truths about the world of Nowhere City Nights await adventurers with the grit to drag these secrets out of the shadows!

Shade Hunter is chock-full of 44 pages of pulp action! It contains a 30-page adventure, a new Private Detective class, new rules for Investigation Skills and a new Nowhere City Nights Patron.
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Wajes Fußballschach!
boardgame.description:
This is a soccer simulation with programmed movement. After all playing figures have been alternately placed on the game board each player notes down 3 moves for his figures on his game chit. The moves are executed alternately. The team leading the ball begins. After the players have executed their moves, 3 new moves are noted down and so on. If the opposing player gets possession of the ball, the remaining movements are void and the players write down three new moves.

The figures move up to 5 spaces (3 if they lead the ball) in any direction.

The player with the most goals after a prearranged time wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Chimaerus: Integrated Transport
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Chimaerus [ kī-mĕr′ĭs ] is an adventurer-oriented medium sized vessel that is made up of three independent ships:

• Leaena (the Lion) - the main body of the ship, holding the living quarters, medical, and FTL systems. This is the largest of the three sections and also serves as a command & control center for the small fleet.

• Krios (the Ram) - a boxy freighter that is little more than a long hold with a small cabin and flight deck on top. When docked it sits between the forward mandibles of the main hull and serves as the primary cargo hold for Chimaerus.

• Drakon (the Dragon) - an armored drop ship or sturdy passenger shuttle. It docks facing rearward at the tail end of the Leaena hull with it’s turret serving as a tail gunner emplacement.

The purpose of Chimaerus is to provide a mobile base of operations for a group of heroes or mercenaries, but one that can split up when needed to accomplish more. There are half a dozen cabins on board, plus ten capsule-bunks for additional crew, marines, or passengers; and a couple more beds on the freighter and in the brig if needed.

The ship is well armed and armored; more than capable of handling itself in a fight. The Drakon attack shuttle can serve as an armored dropship, passenger transport, or recon vessel. Even the Krios cargo ship could serve as a missile boat while Leaena coordinates the attacks and brings its own considerable firepower to bear.

The Chimaerus package contains several highly detailed, layered PDF files:

• Main Book
- 35 page PDF file detailing the interior areas of Chimaerus (Leaena, Krios, & Drakon).
- Contains 3D rendered scenes as well as orthographic views.
- Includes system independent statistics designed for easy adaptation to your game of choice.
- Background, art, and text are on different layers for custom display and printing.

• Map Pages
- 27 page PDF file containing complete interior maps and instructions for assembly.
- Miniature-scale maps for tactical combat with an optional 1 inch = 5 ft grid.
- Divided into pages for easy printing in full color or printer-friendly black and white.
- Selectable layers include: grid, black & white version, and optional cargo.

• Uncut Map Images
- Four PDF files containing large, uncut images of the deckplans for the ships.
- Includes 29x36 and 24x36 inch images of the Chimaerus combined ship plus
smaller images (12x12 and 17x20) for Krios and Drakon.
- Select either a light or dark background (for printing or projection/display).
- Includes layers for grid, black & white version, optional cargo, and background choice.
- Flat jpeg images, grid-aligned, on a dark background are also provided for use on screen.

boardgame.name: Fairhaven and Beyond
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The village of Fairhaven is beset on all sides by corrupted druids, gorgons, ogres, undead, and more! Can your party rise to the occasion and be the heroes Fairhaven Needs?

Fairhaven and Beyond is a collection of adventures for characters level 1-8.

boardgame.name: The Artificer
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Looking for spellpunk character options to match a similar campaign? Find yourself in need of magical crafting, more constructs, a bit of 3.5 in your 5e? Look no further, Ash of Creativity is taking our stab at the Artificer.

You may be wondering "Hey James, why would I pay for this artificer? I've already got one!" And that's a totally fair question, you may well like your current artificer. Or at least, you might not be sufficiently dissatisfied with it to just jump to the next artificer you see. But, ask yourself the following multi-part question. Do you have:

Two new crafting systems that handle crafting everything in the game?
An artificer with a simplified description but just as dynamic gameplay loop?
Several dozen new weapons for your artificers (and anyone else at the table) to use, including firearms, steam guns, and an explosives list?
A dozen new constructs for the artificer to discover or craft or for the discerning GM to throw at their players?
Unique spells for the artificer?
Two artificers?

boardgame.name: Airships of Brackas
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Anyone tired of the same-old dungeon crawls might find more thrill in playing a campaign that sailed the skies! If you've got an itch to add a new element to your setting, this kickstarter funded project is for you.

Airships of Brackas is here to take any GM's campaign to new heights. Sail through the skies on airships with dozens of potential trait-combinations, using templates and patterns to meet the needs of any given party or NPC. Challenge your players with an extensive bestiary! Throw new NPCs into the fray with your party, or send your players on clever and exciting mini-adventures.

So, what's in this book?

First, you'll find 6 sizes of ships, each suited for different roles in a fleet, or utility to an adventuring party.

These ships have a set of simple rules that govern their use

Those ships can be altered with 6 templates and over a dozen patterns for changing the ship's features and structure to suit the needs of your players, factions, or antagonists (nothing says "Villain" like a flying Undead Hulk, sailing over your players). Templates like Zeppelins and sky fortresses add new possibilities for aspiring nobles and military commanders. Patterns offered by master craftsmen further change the qualities of a ship, allowing it to sail higher, carry more cargo, better protect its sails and balloons, coast on the water or sand, or even sink beneath the seas!

Surely we'll need something to protect the ships, won't we?

Given the list of monsters that'll take up a hefty chunk of the book (spoilers!), you absolutely will! You'll find 10+ armaments statted out for any aspiring captain to protect his cargo. This includes options for High Magic and Steampunk settings with interesting varieties of cannons or spell-throwing artillery, letting the GM fine-tune their preferences for the setting.

Did you mention a Bestiary?

Of course! We wouldn't design something for players to gain without fodder to toss at them, now would we? New types of dragons, fey, undead, and even plants will assault your players, giving them bragging rights and special loot, or a horrific, early grave.

boardgame.name: Masterwork Gear of the Realms
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The base 5th edition game lacks both the options and design philosophy oriented towards purchasing and discovering a variety of loot. Magic items are intended to be rare, and when your two meaningful indications of progress are the gaining of levels and magic items, the game slows down. To a crawl, potentially, and it can happen very quickly (assuming you're lucky and the game doesn't begin with an incredibly slow pace). This is in regards to your typical game anyways, where the loot and rewards with the greatest impact on the game overall tend to be related to combat, even if the campaign is ostensibly leaning towards a different mode of play.

How do we fix this? Masterwork Gear of the Realms supports not only a variety of character concepts, but also a variety of different genres and campaign styles. The cosmology in which Brackas is nestled has more of a steampunk bent on the whole, but different concepts like steamworks, electricity, firearms, living weapons, biologically focused magic, munitions, artillery, etc all live largely separated on their own worlds. No matter what kind of campaign the GM is running, this document contains nonmagical loot appropriate for their game.

boardgame.name: The Seer
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Have you been waiting for Psionic character options in 5th edition? I mean Psionic options, not "I cast this spell but with my BRAIN?" I've got you covered. Produced by a very short kickstarter camoaign, this class was produced to grant others an opportunity to experience psionics as they were meant to be played; an interesting, dynamic alternative to magic which makes use of unique mechanics.

Thanks to the generosity of our kickstarter backers, this document also includes the Navigator, a prestige class (another character option missing from 5th) thematically focused on guiding others, whether through planes of existence or the dark recesses of the world. It mixes well with clerics and rangers, both thematically and mechanically!

boardgame.name: Astral Tides
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Brought to you from kickstarter, Astral Tides provides a boatload of new content for planeshopping adventures and campaigns! New character races and feats provide your players with new tools for creating exotic, alien characters. Pilot planesfaring vehicles called conveyances, and load them with unique artillery from other realms! Enjoy a 30 page set of non-magical masterwork equipment, providing a GM with an extraordinary pool of new loot, as well as offering new mechanics and tags to weapons and armor. All this and more are neatly wrapped in descriptions of several material worlds and over a dozen new realms bordering and connecting them, giving the GM lore and new plot hooks on a cosmic scale!

boardgame.name: Dekker's Duels
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Has spellcasting grown stale in your game? Aching for the cool effects and team dynamic casters could bring to the table in older games? Do you wish mage-on-mage fights could have a sense of dynamism and scale fundamentally missing from the game?

We've got you covered. Enter a dueling system for 5e! This easy-to-resolve mage dueling system allows your spellcasters to layer additional effects on to their spells at the cost of limiting who it is they target (namely, the other person in the duel). This tradeoff makes for interesting scenarios in which your players can participate and impact the outcome of the duel.

Because certain effects can change the battlefield depending on who's caught in them, this gives the other party members an opportunity to participate in the duel the way they couldn't with typical spellcasting. They know who must be targeted by the spells cast by the mage, and can move around and manipulate events so as to maximize the impact of said spells.

Though additional rolls are still being made, the teamwork element allows the party to become invested in each resolution, and provides another mechanical incentive to pay attention.

boardgame.name: The Alchemist
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Designers have been searching for ages on how to create a proper alchemist class, all with varying degrees of success. It's no wonder; taking a section of the game (consumable items) and translating it to class features is no easy task! Enter yours truly, a third party designer for 5th Edition.

A fully developed, fleshed out, professional quality class for easy application to any game, recently revised from its original Kickstarter release. Dozens of unique and easily parsed alchemical items can be combined with 3 Alchemical Studies (archetypes) for a versatile addition to any party.

boardgame.name: Tu Letra
boardgame.description:
"Tu letra" is a quick, simple and fun word game and deduction.
Those who enjoy wordplay and are looking for something new to surprise friends and family can't help but try "Tu Letra"!

A player (director) looks at the letter he received (secret letter) and chooses the family of words the players should use.
The players in turn have to do the actions:
A) Say a word belonging to the family indicated by the director and ask if the secret letter is in it
If yes, add a card to your deck. If NO, place a card from the deck face up.
B) Try to guess what the letter is

If it is correct, the player gains one point.
If incorrect, the player must place 3 cards from his hand on the table.

The game ends when a player reaches three victory points.

Tu Letra es un juego de palabras y deducción rápido, sencillo y divertido.
¡Aquellos que disfruten de los juegos de palabras y estén buscando algo nuevo con lo que sorprender a amigos y familiares no pueden dejar de probar Tu Letra!

boardgame.name: Cities: Encounters
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Gamesmasters! Do you run Dungeons and Dragons, D20, Pathfinder, or other RPG? Are your city adventures bland and listless? Are your cities and towns just places for characters to buy stuff and sell their swag? Are you ready to advance your players' games beyond the dungeon and get them involved in the ebb and flow of the city?

Well here's your tool to add a whole new dimension to your city game experiences. Based on Midkemia Press' Cities book, this is the only fully licensed product that brings city encounter and expedition ideas to your digital tabletop.
