By simply selecting the area of town, the time of day and whether encounters are to occur on main streets or side streets City Encounters generates hundreds of situational ideas just waiting to pull your unsuspecting characters into the power politics or criminal underbelly of the city. Additionally included is a simple expeditions generator, producing hundreds of expedition ideas to trigger adventures for your players.

Get out of that hole in the ground! Come visit the City (and be sure to leave some of your hard earned treasure behind)! It doesn't matter which RPG you play this is the tool for you.

The free version limits you to generates one encounter at a time tailored for the Merchant Quarter during the Day and on Main streets. For just $0.99 you can upgrade with an in-app purchase and generate multiple encounters at once using all the combinations of Area of Town, Time of Day, and Street type.

boardgame.name: We Shall Meet in Vienna: 1813 in Germany – The Spring Campaign to After the Armistice
boardgame.description:
We shall meet in Vienna includes everything you need to begin recreating the two phases of the War of Liberation in Germany: organization, maps, historical briefings, and uniforms.

During the passionate negotiations of the spring of 1813 between France and Austria, Napoleon would dismiss Metternich by declaring, We shall meet in Vienna! threatening to repeat the capture of the Austrian capital as he had done in 1805 and again in 1809.

Desperately short of cavalry, having just raised a new army of largely raw recruits, rallying around a cadre of survivors from the invasion of Russia, Napoleon took command of La Grande Armée in the spring of 1813 determined to turn back the coalition forces seeking to dismantle the French Empire.

We shall meet in Vienna offers nine scenarios covering The Spring Campaign and the period After the Armistice:

1st Möckern
Lützen
Bautzen
Großbeern – and a second scenario for Blankenfelde
Katzbach
Dresden
Hagelberg
1st Kulm


250 pages, The Wargaming Company’s largest Campaign Guide to-date.
Additionally, We shall meet in Vienna offers a late war uniform guide with over 1500 uniform plates, all in full color, covering every unit featured in the scenarios.

We shall meet in Vienna, 1813 in Germany is compatible with Et sans résultat! (both ESR Original Edition & ESR Second Edition), and nearly any other Napoleonic tabletop wargame. Orders of battle provide detail down to the battalion level and maps are offered in scale miles.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Et sans résultat! Tabletop Rules for Recreating the Napoleonic Wars

boardgame.name: What's So Cool About Being a Fantasy Adventurer?
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

What's So Cool About Being a Fantasy Adventurer? is a hack of Jared Sinclair's What's So Cool About Outer Space? and was done for the What is So Cool About Jam.

You are an Adventurer! A bold explorer of lost ruins, a defeater of monsters that prey on the weak, a delver of ancient dungeons, a defender of the innocent! Or maybe you just kill things and take their stuff.

To play the game, you will need at least two six-sided dice (d6) and preferably more than two and some way of writing down your character, whether on paper or electronically.

The supplement contains eight d6 tables for helping to create a character, twelve places to explore, twelve legendary treasures and twelve rumours to hear.

The PDF uses Adobe layers and the backgrounds and images can be disabled for a printer friendly version. Click here to see a YouTube video on how this works.

This is an eight page PDF with one page being the front cover and one the front matter. For a look at the entire supplement, please see the preview video.
boardgame.rpgseries: What Is So Cool About Jam
boardgame.rpg: What's So Cool About Being a Fantasy Adventurer?

boardgame.name: 100 Weird or Unsettling Childhood Events
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This is a collection of 100 different things from a character's childhood that could shape their later life. The events can relate directly to a character's experiences, or they could be related to the place where they were born. Some are odd, some are unsettling and some are weird. Explanations are not given for what might have caused an event; that could be for a character to find out. These childhood events can be used to develop a character's background and could also be used as a source of potential adventure hooks.

This PDF supports Adobe layers and the page backgrounds and images can be disabled to make printing easier.

Here are some sample results:

People in your village used to die, just as would be expected, but there were no graves in the graveyard newer than a century old.

Pets in your village would keep disappearing without a trace. Eventually, people stopped getting them.

Runes were carved into every brick, plank, tile and timber of your childhood home. To this day, you do not know what they meant.

Several nights a year, all the animals in your village would howl or cry all through the night.

Several times a year, sigils would be drawn in animal blood on the doors of some of the houses in your village.

One page is the front cover, one page is the front matter and half of a page is ads.

boardgame.name: Master of the World: 1812 in Russia – The Invasion
boardgame.description:
Master of the World, 1812 in Russia, Phase One: The Invasion
The 1812 campaign is arguably Napoleon’s most well known campaign and one of the great tragedies of military history. It is also the story of Russia’s First Great Patriotic War, repelling a great invader. In excess of 600,000 soldiers and support personnel crossed the Niemen River from the Grand Duchy of Warsaw into Imperial Russia under the French Imperial flag beginning on 24 June, 1812.

Master of the World includes everything you need to begin recreating the first phase of Napoleon's disastrous 1812 Russian campaign: organization, maps, historical briefings, and uniforms.

One campaign
Nine scenarios
Twenty-seven maps
Over 800 uniform images!
created especially for inclusion in this series and offering Nearly 200 pages



Let's start a land war in Asia…
9 scenarios covering the French main army's advance to Moscow:

Mir
Saltanovka – Two versions: The Spoiler Attack and Clear the Way to Mogilev
Ostrovno
Vitebsk
1st Krasne
Smolensk – Two versions: Preserve the Army and Save the Holy City
Lubino
Schwardino
Borodino


The Master of the World Campaign Guide is compatible with Et sans résultat! Original and Second Edition as well as most any other tabletop Napoleonic wargame.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Et sans résultat! Tabletop Rules for Recreating the Napoleonic Wars

boardgame.name: 100 Rumours to Hear in or About the Great Rift: Corridor and Reft
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

When asking around in the spaceport bar or anywhere else, Travellers may overhear rumours about events on other worlds. They may be insuring about a different matter entirely and stumble across additional information by accident. This supplement has 100 rumours that Travellers could hear. They can be used as misdirection, background information or as potential adventure hooks. The rumours in this supplement cover the Great Rift, in particular the sectors of Corridor and Reft, though the occasional astronomical feature from other Great Rift sectors may be mentioned.

This PDF supports Adobe layers and the page backgrounds and images can be disabled to make printing easier.

Here are some sample results:

The Great Reef is a strange and dangerous area where ships suffer a higher than normal number of misjumps, something that is officially put down to mundane problems such as poor-quality fuel. Recently, the number of reported misjumps in the Great Reef has been increasing, and some ships have reputedly been completely lost. One suggestion for the existence of jumpspace reefs is that they are connected to the Ancients in some way. Perhaps someone has found whatever technology is responsible for the Great Reef and is experimenting with it.

The Great Rift can be a dangerous place to travel at the best of times, due to a lack of refuelling stops. However, the crossings make the journey much safer. In recent months, though, there have been claims that a number of ships using the Islands Crossing have been failing to reach their destinations, even though this is a well-travelled route with adequate refuelling stops. Various theories have been posited, from sensible ones such as an increase in misjumps to pirates, to more outlandish ones such as hidden planets and surviving Ancients.

The highport of Petre in the Vestus subsector of Reft is known for its conversions of ex-navy fighters into one- or two-seater racing craft. These are used in small craft racing and Petre has started sponsoring more races for such, which are held in the system. The manufacturers are apparently planning to hold a major race at some point, with the hopes of attracting contestants from other sectors, but this has been plagued with trouble, to the degree that some suspect sabotage is involved.

The Imperial Navy is rumoured to have a location somewhere inside the Great Rift, in deep space away from any solar systems, where there is a base for crews patrolling the rift to stand down for some R&R. However, there are rumours that, wherever this base is, it has suddenly fallen silent, with all contact lost. There is no official comment on the rumours, but there is no official acknowledgement that such a base exists anyway.

The Imperial Interstellar Scout Service has a regular courier link across the Great Rift, with typically two couriers in transit at any time. There are rumours that one of the expected couriers is now overdue, having left its last port but not having arrived at the next. It's unclear whether this is thought to be due to some sort of accident or something more hostile.

One page is the front cover, one page is the front matter and one a page is ads.

boardgame.name: The Forever Man
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Forever Man sees the characters uncover a man crushed beneath a stone, a man who will regenerate most damage. He has been trapped under the stone for years and will want to regain his lands and punish the descendants of those who trapped him.

This is aimed at d100 systems but is generic enough in nature to be adapted to others.

This PDF supports Adobe layers and the page backgrounds and images can be disabled to make printing easier.

One page is the cover, one the front matter and one page is ads.

boardgame.name: Titanomachy
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The second war against the Gods fast approaches.
Are you prepared?

Scion: Titanomachy has everything a Storyguide needs to bring the Second Titanomachy — a phase in the eternal cold war against the Gods — to their Scion Second Edition games.

It presents new threats from the Titans to their servants, plus their fell powers and Birthrights — ripe for use as antagonists or as new material for players’ characters. It also provides adventure hooks to springboard Storyguides into the action.

Scion: Origin and Scion: Hero are required to use this book.

This book includes:

Titans for each of the core pantheons, to be used as enemies or strange allies.
Three adventure hooks to help Storyguides run epic games involving the Second Titanomachy.
Dozens of all-new antagonists from enemy Scions to fearsome monsters.
New, Titan-themed Birthrights and Knacks for players to discover and use.

boardgame.name: What's So Cool About Outer Space?
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

WSCAOS is a tiny little system for going to space no matter where you are!

1 Print out the little pages and paste them in the front of a Moleskine, or onto 3x5 index cards.
2 Add a couple of dice! (The six-sided ones, please! I've never seen a d20 in space, have you?)
3 Oh, don't forget your pencil!
4 You're good to go!
boardgame.rpgseries: What Is So Cool About Jam
boardgame.rpg: What's So Cool About Outer Space?

boardgame.name: The Most Awful Situation: 1814 in France – The Campaign of France & The Six Days
boardgame.description:
The Most Awful Situation, 1814 in France: The Campaign of France and The Six Days

After the crushing defeat of the French Army at Leipzig, a series of small actions allowed what was left to retire into France; but the hostilities continued through January as the Allies pressed vigorously. In mid-February the Emperor had determined to change the conditions of the war. Outnumbered four to one, the French would go on the offensive. Napoleon conducted the most brilliant campaign of his career: The Six Days; fighting and winning four battles in six days.

The Most Awful Situation includes everything you need to begin recreating the first two phases of 1814: organization, maps, historical briefings, and uniforms.

Two campaigns,
Nine scenarios,
Twenty-seven maps,
hundreds of uniform images created especially for inclusion in this series and offering!


Outnumbered 4:1, bring it on…
10 scenarios covering both the initial Campaign of France and The Six Days:

Hoogstraten
1st Bar-sur-Aube
Brienne
La Rothière
Lesmont
Nogent
Champaubert
Montmirail
Château-Thierry
Vauchamps


The Most Awful Situation Campaign Guide is compatible with Et sans résultat! Original and Second Edition as well as most any other tabletop Napoleonic wargame.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Et sans résultat! Tabletop Rules for Recreating the Napoleonic Wars

boardgame.name: Azukail Games September 2020 Newsletter
boardgame.description:
This newsletter has an update on the products releasing in September 2020.

These are:

10 Ammunition Spells (PFRPG)
100 Books to Find on an Ifrian Bookshelf
100 Conspiracy Theories to Encounter
100 Encounters for Fantasy Mountains (Zweihander)
100 Familiars to Encounter
100 Notes and Letters to Find in Pugmire
100 Sights to See at the Faire
100 Sights to See in a Steampunk City
Book Cover 8
Creeping Undeath
Filler Art – Clockwork Robot
Laboratory of the Terramancer

boardgame.name: Hero Realms: 5 Personaggi – Chierico, Guerriero, Ladro, Mago, Ranger
boardgame.description:
Go on an adventure with your friends, face perilous missions and fight against fearsome foes!

A character deck takes the place of the individual deck in the Hero Realms card game.

—description from the publisher (translated)

This is a pack containing all 5 character decks which are usually sold separately.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Massive Darkness: Companion App
boardgame.description:
The Massive Darkness Companion App serves as a digital replacement for the Hero Dashboards used in the boardgame to keep track of each character’s inventory, experience and skills. And the app goes beyond that, offering players some cool extra aids as well.

Some of the features of the Companion App include:

A virtual deck of equipment cards which allows to control your heroes' inventory.
The app control the Monster, Equipment, Door and Event decks.
As you gain experience your new Skill options are automatically displayed, and the app incorporates any pertinent new game effects.
The Action Bar, allows players to tick off each specific action as you take it, so you always know what actions you have left.
Choose any of the Hero characters, including promos.
Network capabilities; each player can use their own device if preferred.

boardgame.name: Pooman Cards
boardgame.description:
A twist on the family classic monster chases around the house, evolving it into a new format of flip and chase.

One player is the monsterous game-master Pooman, flipping the cards selected by the other players to reveal an array of characters.

Cards flipped reveal either collectable character cards, special cards or Pooman cards.

Character cards have puntastic names like 'Uriah Niles', and can have brown stars for players to bank points.

Special Cards can have powers to help defend against the Pooman, like freezing power of the 'Poocicle'.

If a Pooman is revealed then players must RUN the game-master will count to 10 and chase the player with the most stars;
if any player is grabbed by the Pooman then all their cards are lost! First player to collect 5 brown stars wins!
Each pack includes 10 blank cards for players to create their own characters.

A new twist on an old classic - varying it so the chase is in short bursts and players can apply tactics and compete against other players to win victory over the Pooman.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Loonacy: International Tabletop Day Expansion
boardgame.description: An expansion for Loonacy containing five new cards featuring the International Tabletop Day logo paired with images from the game.

boardgame.name: Das Schwarze Auge – Dämonenfluch
boardgame.description: Fantasy
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2004 German Developer Award Best Mobile Game of the Year Winner

boardgame.name: Leisure Suit Larry - Kühle Drinks und heisse Girls
boardgame.description: Adventure
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2005 German Developer Award Best PC/Casual Game of the Year Winner

boardgame.name: Sacred Underworld
boardgame.description: Ancaria is facing a threat far greater than ever before. The now familiar world continues to evolve, with existing SACRED players able to import their old characters into the Underworld.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2005 German Developer Award Best Double A PC Game of the Year Winner
2005 German Developer Award Best Interface of the Year Winner
2005 German Developer Award Best RPG of the Year Winner

boardgame.name: Red Ocean
boardgame.description: Jack Hard hires a fellow diver to explore an old Second World War Submarine. He soon finds that there is an entrance to an underground complex nearby. An operative contacts him over the radio telling him that his fellow diver is actually a member of the CIA. Jack then soon finds him dead and must take up the fight. The plot takes place in an abandoned, underwater, secret Soviet base that has been taken over by terrorists.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2007 German Developer Award Best German Action Game of the Year Winner

boardgame.name: Roll up that Map, 1805 in Germany: The Ulm and Austerlitz Campaigns
boardgame.description:
Roll up that Map, 1805 in Germany, The Ulm & Austerlitz Campaigns

A series of small but pivotal engagements around the Ulm region allowed Napoleon to cut off nearly all routes of escape from Ulm and strategically surround the city. The Austerlitz Campaign is arguably Napoleon’s most effective campaign, culminating in one of the greatest successful gambles of military history. It is the campaign which introduced La Grande Armée to the world, a highly trained, highly motivated, flexibly organized military system which was the culmination and extension of military evolution to-date.

Roll up that Map includes everything you need to begin recreating both phases of Napoleon's brilliant 1805 German campaign: organization, maps, historical briefings, and uniforms.

Two campaigns,
Nine scenarios,

boardgame.name: Tumbleweed
boardgame.description:
Tumbleweed is a two-player game. It is played on a hexhex board and a sufficient supply of stacked checkers.

A stack can "see" a hex, when they are connected by a straight line, with no stacks in between. The players take turns placing stacks of their tokens on hexes that are seen by at least one friendly stack. The height of every newly-placed stack equals the number of your stacks that see the new stack. Replacing an existing stack with a new stack is possible, as long as the new stack is taller than the previous one. This works with opponent stacks (to capture), or your own stacks (to reinforce).

Before the game, the host sets up the board and the guest decides which side he wants to play. Setup consists of one stack of two neutral tokens in the central hex, and a single starting token for each player in hexes of the host's choosing.

The game ends when no more moves can be made by either player, or after two successive passes. The player who occupies over half the board wins.

Tumbleweed was voted Best Combinatorial 2-Player Game of 2020 on BGG.

boardgame.name: Didn't Dare Do Anything: 1812 in Russia – The Flanks of the Invasion
boardgame.description:
Didn't Dare Do Anything is the first sequel to Master of the World, 1812 in Russia!
When Napoleon invaded Russia in the summer of 1812, he detached forces both north and south to cover the flanks of the Main Army. The Russians were forced to respond by doing the same. But separated from their chief, the hesitant, and sometimes reluctant generals acted erratically. Their uncertainly made only worse by the Emperor's constant correspondence of orders, questions, and demands.
Didn't Dare Do Anything provides scenarios pitting former allies like the Austrians and Russians against each other, as well as highlighting Russian initiative vs French hesitancy. Didn't Dare Do Anything is a unique look into the problems that would snowball to plague Napoleon's 1813 campaigns.

boardgame.description:
To Assure My Dynasty, 1808 in Iberia
The entrance of the French Empire into a war on the Iberian Peninsula parallels numerous quagmires throughout history, initial success, which developed into a never ending burden. Having determined that the Spanish government did not hold the confidence of its people, and realizing, due to lack of both will and ability, it would never fulfill its responsibilities of allegiance to France, Napoleon determined plans must be made. Upon discovering agents of the Spanish throne discussed Spain’s potential role against France with her enemies, the Emperor decided such plans must be acted upon.
The seemingly never ending pursuit actions across the Iberian landscape of Spain and Portugal provided a stream of empty victories to the French, until finally, the British Expeditionary Force is expelled from the continent at La Coruña.
To Assure My Dynasty, 1808 in Iberia presents Phase One: The Spanish Uprising in four scenarios, pitting Napoleon’s Imperial Army against the Royal Army of Spain, and the British Expeditionary Force and its Portuguese supporters. Followed by Phase Two: The Emperor's Arrival with another eight scenarios, ending with La Coruña.
To Assure My Dynasty includes everything you need to begin recreating the opening phases of the Peninsular War: organization, maps, historical briefings, and uniforms.

boardgame.name: Trivial Pursuit: La Grande Guerre 1914 - 1918 – Liège
boardgame.description:
This is the mini edition of The Great War 1914-1918 of the famous game Trivial Pursuit.

In this edition, 330 questions for adults, and 330 more designed for the youngest.

The goal remains to be the first to fill in his pie chart by correctly answering the 6 categories of questions and obtaining the corresponding triangles.



A l’occasion de la commémoration du centenaire de la Première Guerre Mondiale, la Province de Liège a prévu de nombreuses activités pour entretenir le souvenir de cet évènement. Mais, comment transmettre l’Histoire d’une nation, et de cette crise internationale spécifique, aux générations futures ? Nous avons relevé ce challenge en personnalisant un Trivial Pursuit qui valorise cet héritage historique.
Cette édition thématique du troisième jeu le plus vendu au monde, spéciale « La Grande Guerre 1914 -­‐ 1918 » est l’occasion de parcourir les 330 questions qui sont réparties en 6 catégories. Les aspects géographiques sont abordés , de même que les personnes qui ont joué un rôle important, ainsi que les armes et le matériel utilisé, et surtout le rôle exemplaire de Liège dans la Grande Guerre.
Le célèbre jeu Trivial Pursuit rime avec savoir et connaissances, tout en étant ludique. Il est le support idéal pour illustrer le conflit historique qu’est la Première Guerre Mondiale !

boardgame.name: Drott
boardgame.description:
Drott is a chess like game played on a 13x13 hnefatafl board. Two opposing armies vie for victory via one of three win conditions. Either: 1. Defeat the opponent's king. 2. March the king into the castle (the center square) or 3. Invade conquer the opponent's fort. (the starting squares of the pieces).

Drott is designed to create local battles that will later impact the whole board. Therefore no pieces can move across the whole feature. Each piece is also used only once, and has unique movement. Fights are therefore dynamic and exiting.

Drott means king in old norse, and the game is lightly themed to fit the old kings of the north. The names of the pieces are, bowman, skjolding (pawns), berserker, spearman, wolf, elf, hunter, dwarf and king.

A special feature of Drott is that pieces diagonally aligned cannot be passed through, but there are two open flanks on the side. Due to the three winning conditions, draws are extremely unlikely to happen.

—description from the designer

Соображарий Супер ("Think It Up: Super") expands the Think It Up! series with a new twist: each turn, you will reveal two Categories and will try to be the first to come up with an answer that will suit them both! Quick-wittedness is encouraged, but creativity is key!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Кто первым скажет, что можно увидеть за полярным кругом и использовать на шумной вечеринке? А много ли песен, связанных с игрушками и настольными играми, вы вспомните за минуту? На долгие раздумья нет времени — отгадывайте, или победные очки достанутся кому-то другому!

«Соображарий Супер» — новая версия настольного хита для семейных посиделок и зажигательных вечеринок. boardgame.name: The Darkling Legacy (ZWEIHÄNDER)

An Ancient Curse

A Time-Honored Heroic Sacrifice

And An Epic Quest

The Darkling Legacy

A terrible danger stalks the Umbral Woods surrounding Hausen. Darklings, creatures of unknown origin and malicious intent, claim the woods as their own. These savage creatures have plagued the dark corners of the wood since time immemorial. Every one hundred years, the town’s most accomplished warrior, sound of heart and strong of mind, heads deep into the heart of the Umbral Wood to stem the tide of the Darklings.

It has been twenty years since the last great hero of Hausen, Markos Mac-Tirig, journeyed into the Umbral Wood. But dark shadows have been spotted stalking the wood line, and citizens of Hausen have been found dead on the outskirts of town covered in the black viscera characteristic of the Darkling form. Concerned elders decide a new expedition is needed to make right the apparent failure of the last hero, but find none willing to accept the honor. Desperation forces them to look beyond their village borders.

The Darkling Legacy is a 46-page adventure for Zweihander RPG. Inside the Darkling Legacy you will find:

An adventure for Intermediate Tier characters where choices matter;
10-20 hours of play time depending on play styles;
A dark mystery to be solved;
8 new adversaries, from powerful NPCs to terrible monsters;
An open-ended conclusion.

Sand Sorcery


Additionally, Sorcerous Origins offers two spells to round things out.

boardgame.name: Letters From the Leagues Volume 2
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hot from the Leagues!

Collected together for the first time are various articles and discourses from the illustrious members of the Leagues of Adventure, Leagues of Gothic Horror, and Leagues of Cthulhu.
Within these pages you will find:

In Search of Noah’s Ark: Calling all raiders! This information is a must if you are seeking the power of the Ark.
Vampire Households: Build a veritable nest of vipers! This informative article provides all the details for creating bloodsucking households!
The Ministry Files: Delve into the secret files of the Ministry of Unusual Affairs and find some sage information that was previously misfiled!
Professor Pennyworth’s Catalog of Gadgets: A selection of curious inventions for your adventures!
Concerning Dinosaurs: The latest paleontological findings and where to find them!
Faeries & The Ministry: Be informed! There are faeries out there and agents need to be ready to deal with them!
Inheritance: It’s not just gaining your dear old grandmother’s house, you can inherit all kinds of assets - good & bad!

boardgame.name: Letters From the Leagues Volume 3
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hot from the Leagues!

Collected together for the first time are various articles and discourses from the illustrious members of the Leagues of Adventure, Leagues of Gothic Horror, and Leagues of Cthulhu.

Within these pages you will find:

Who Was Imhotep: An interesting delve into the chequered history of legendary figure, Imhotep.
More Mummies: We all love our mummies, but do you love these frightening creatures?
More Apparitions: A collection of bone tingling ghosts that will haunt any globetrotter!
Historical Facts as Lists & Tables: A handy reference guide to historical events during the age of globetrotters.
Firearms for the 1890’s: The finest guns fit for any globetrotter!
Serial Killers: These dastardly villains can be hiding in plain sight. It’s best to be wary of strangers!
Voodoo: We spotlight the dark loa in this brief overview.

boardgame.name: Lejentia Player's Handbook
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Greetings adventurers. This world is called Lejentia, based upon the Ælvish word meaning "for all life." It is quite possible that Lejentia is our Earth in the far future, although none alive can say for sure. The planet consists of four major land masses, three oceans, and a handful of seas.

From the appendix:

LEJENTIA PLAYERS HANDBOOK is a pre-publication version of Lejentia Campaigns Book One: Skully's Harbor, book I of the LEJENTIA CAMPAIGNS Series, soon to be published by Fantasy Games Unlimited.

boardgame.name: Schnapp die Möpse: Ultimate Edition
boardgame.description:
The Ultimate Edition of Schnapp die Möpse consists of the base game and 2 Expansions in a big box.

The UE was published during the 2020 Kickstarter campaign for the second expansion for Schnapp die Möpse.

Kickstarter Stretch Goals:

Big Paper Box (Upgrade to Ultimate Edition)
3rd Mini-Expansion (Beyond)
Active Player Marker
7 Playerboards
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Schnapp die Möpse: Rainbow Wars Erweiterung

boardgame.name: Super Mario 3D All-Stars
boardgame.description:
Play three of Mario’s greatest 3D platform adventures—all in one package!
Play three classic games at home or on the go—all in one package on the Nintendo Switch™ system! Jump into paintings in Super Mario 64™, clean up paint-like goop in Super Mario Sunshine™, and fly from planet to planet in Super Mario Galaxy™.

Run, jump, and dive with ease!

Make Mario move using the Nintendo Switch system’s Joy-Con™ controllers. You can also pass a Joy-Con controller to a friend to play the Super Mario Galaxy game in Co-Star Mode! Mario’s movements are as smooth as ever with HD resolution for each game, while still retaining the look and feel of the originals.

Listen to timeless Super Mario tunes

Listen to a total of 175 iconic tunes from all three games! Whether you want to get up and dance or take a minute to relax—this collection has music to fit your mood!

Discover (or rediscover) three of Mario’s most iconic 3D platform adventures, all in one package, available on the Nintendo Switch™ system. Experience Mario’s first foray into 3D platforming in the Super Mario 64™ game, originally released in 1996. Wall jump, backflip, and even fly as you explore paintings and collect Power Stars to save Princess Peach!
Soak up the sun in the Super Mario Sunshine™ game, originally released in 2002, and spray the goop away with your water-spouting pal, FLUDD! You’ll need to collect Shine Sprites and clear the picturesque Isle Delfino of pollution—just look out for Bowser Jr.
Defy gravity as you explore space in the Super Mario Galaxy™ game, originally released in 2007! Help Rosalina restore her ship by collecting Power Stars and save Princess Peach. Gently shake a Joy-Con™ controller to activate Mario’s Spin ability or pass a Joy-Con controller to a friend for some extra help in Co-Star Mode*.
Even when you aren’t playing, you can enjoy the sounds that these worlds (and galaxies!) are so famous for. With three games, modern upgrades, and music-player mode, this collection is filled with fun for both new players and 3D platforming Mario masters.

Source: The Publisher Website.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 NAVGTR Award Best Game Revival of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: 100 Overheard Space Port Chatter 11
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

So the explorers are hanging out at a busy space port… most likely one of the seedier bars… and they hear a bunch of chatter around them. Some things are day to day conversation, while other bits of audible noise could be clues or potential adventure hooks. This chart provides the GM the advantage of being able to roll the percentile dice and come back with a snippet of dialogue should a character want to make a listen check.

boardgame.name: 100 Overheard Space Port Chatter 10
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

boardgame.name: 100 Galactic Files for Data Brokers 3
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In a galaxy full of strange and wondrous natural resources another valuable commodity exists… information. Data is constantly being gathered on anything and everything. Some of this collected information makes it’s way to the final intended destination while other data is lost along the way. Sometimes stolen, sometimes scrambled, other times left behind in destroyed or malfunctioning machinery. This 100 list provides the Game Master with a wealth of detailed data files. In addition to a data type and descriptive information the author has provided a recommended value for the recovered data in monetary credits. This can be a useful game stat should the GM allow the character(s) to try to hawk data that they have recovered on the marketplace. Some entries may also prove useful as adventure hooks or valuable clues.

boardgame.name: Cave Evil: Chaos Pack 2
boardgame.description:
18 new cards to add to Conjuration and other Decks

1 Mini Map "King of the Hell" 11" x 17" map that can be played on its own, added on top of other maps, or can extend maps.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

boardgame.name: 50 Hirelings 3
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Adventurers need hirelings… from traveling companions to camp defenders to folks working the fields back home. This 50 list offers a collection of such individuals who are ready for hire. Included in each entry is the following: first and last name, gender, role/occupation, active description, background description, and expected daily wages in copper or silver coins*.

boardgame.name: 100 Professionals Set 19
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 100 different professionals that are perfect drop ins for a modern/crime role playing game. This list is also useful for survivors for a post apocalyptic or zombie outbreak setting as well as a cyberpunk/near future dystopia that has many existing modern day occupations and elements. Included in each entry is first and last name, gender, age, and occupational skill/role.

boardgame.name: Zalkasa Wastes
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Though wearing your hazard suit you cannot help but to gasp a little from behind the comforts of your helmet… despite the benefit of an electronic cooling unit and humidity regulator you can sense the discomfort of the hot and dry landscape around you. How anyone could manage to live in this place is a mystery to you. Regardless, there are indeed folks living here… and thriving here in some places economically. And that’s why your employer sent you here.

You take off your helmet as you walk into one of the various seedy bars of Dankar City. Folks can tell you are not from town… its obvious by your spacesuit and your inability to simply deal with the hot, dry environment… but that’s fine. You’re supposed to not blend in entirely… your assumed role is that of a wealthy investor’s flunky. You work up the story that you are traveling to the area to check on the progress with a recent investment in cobalt mining and your employer has some concerns. The locals don’t have to know that the real concern is that you are planning to sabotage the mine site...

This role playing game supplement contains an overland hex map of a region that is a combination of barren waste and seawater. This area is suitable for star faring campaign settings. The map has commonly recognized earth tones and the detailed entries describe a world that is lush but sometimes quite bizarre. Each hex on the map represents 10 kilometers and there are 17 numbered areas on the map total. Each of the numbered areas contains details that help the Game Master (GM) plot out a potential adventure, dangerous encounter, or friendly settlement or space port. The GM is welcome to further add on to the location with additional encounters, events, or important locations if they so wish.

After the main page you will find two bonus encounter charts. One is for land encounters and the other for aquatic encounters. The GM should use this chart any time the characters are exploring unmarked locations on the map and the action is starting to get dull.

Two additional versions of the map are provided. One version lacks the numbered locations and the descriptions, giving the GM something to print if they wish to present to the player characters. The characters can use this map to keep track of where they have been and where they might be going (or wishing to explore). The second version adds extra blank marker circles (in a pinkish tone) to allow the GM to add some of their own points of interest to the map.

The detailed map entries are written in a manner that allows the product to be as game system/edition generic as possible. The flavor is that of typical space opera variety, allowing you to add or remove as much of a “space fantasy” flavor as you need. As discussed prior, all the important bits are kept to one sheet of paper, allowing you to print off only that if you wish and also allowing you to quickly reference locations without having to flip through a bunch of pages.

boardgame.name: 100 Spaceport Robots V12.0
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list provides 100 different robots that the characters might encounter while visiting a busy spaceport. Included is the robot's "name", role/function, and a brief descriptive.

boardgame.name: 100 Spaceport Robots V11.0
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list provides 100 different robots that the characters might encounter while visiting a busy spaceport. Included is the robot's "name", role/function, and a brief descriptive.

boardgame.name: 100 Spaceport Robots V10.0
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list provides 100 different robots that the characters might encounter while visiting a busy spaceport. Included is the robot's "name", role/function, and a brief descriptive.

boardgame.name: 100 Alien Biome Locations 23
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Need to flesh out some quick locations for that planet the characters are on but you don’t have time to think up anything? Use this list instead! This product features 100 space age locations that can be dropped on to most worlds. Included is a full name (with geographic type) as well as some notable feature or something the characters would find in the particular location.

boardgame.name: 100 Alien Biome Locations 22
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Need to flesh out some quick locations for that planet the characters are on but you don’t have time to think up anything? Use this list instead! This product features 100 space age locations that can be dropped on to most worlds. Included is a full name (with geographic type) as well as some notable feature or something the characters would find in the particular location.

boardgame.name: 50 Modern Suburb Residents 7
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 50 different residents and homes that are perfect for a modern suburbia (notably United States) environment. Included in each entry are the following: Name of home owner(s), total number of occupants (presented as Oc#: #), style of home (craftsman, neo-classical, cape cod, etc.), number of bedrooms and bathrooms, and a brief descriptive of either the yard or interior of home (rose bushes, air hockey table, etc.). Perfect for quickly fleshing out modern neighborhoods from crime/drama settings, super hero settings, early zombie outbreak, early apocalypse, etc.

boardgame.name: 100 Blue Collar Workers 10
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 100 different blue collar workers that are perfect drop ins for a modern/crime role playing game. This list is also useful for survivors for a post apocalyptic or zombie outbreak setting. Included in each entry is first and last name, gender, age, and occupational skill/role.

boardgame.name: 100 Millionaires 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This 100 list features a whole bunch of millionaires for your modern era campaign. Some folks have barely broke their first million while other entries are more suited for multi-millionaires who are steadily working towards breaking into the billionaire territory. Each entry includes first and last name, gender, age, role/occupation, and a general descriptive.

boardgame.name: Those Magnificent Men
boardgame.description:
In 1923 a coalition of nations embarked on a convert mission of genocide. Deep in the Pacific Ocean the Last of the Strange forms of Man {Vampire, Werewolf, Merman, Mummy and Tinman} Tried to Fight off the Invaders.

You Play as a Three Man Crew of a Bi-plane Delivering goods, Rescuing Survivors and Shooting Down the Invaders.

The game plays in two phases. After selected the objective card, the first phase, the players draft cards one at a time a choose whether to hire the crew, or build the map. Once all players have 3 crew, the game moves to phase 2.

In phase 2, the players execute one of three action rows to pick goods, deliver goods, rescue survivors and shoot down invaders.

The game ends when the objective card is completed and the winner is the one with the most cash.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: 50 Wise Guys 4
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 50 different modern wise guys that are perfect for your modern/crime role playing setting. Included in each entry is a name (first, last, and sometimes a nickname), age, brief description, specialty (criminal activity or area of knowledge), and signature weapon.

boardgame.name: 100 Random Weapon Descriptions - Volume 099
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Ever been in a dungeon and needed some items to give it that extra pop? Have your players gotten used to all the special weapons available in the core rulebooks? Never fear. Within this collection are 100 different weapon names. Some good, some evil, some indifferent. Whether catering to players who love to collect rare items, or just looking to add some extra zing to a random treasure table; this collection of weapon names is categorized as a quick table capable of handling either situation.

How to Use This Book

Grab a set of percentile dice (d100) and roll to determine what the random weapon is that your player may have just stumbled upon. Players should show caution as these weapons are very descriptive yet still leave an open end for their game master to add their own choice of abilities to the back end. Partner this table with one of our random room tables to generate a fully in-depth treasure location. Gather your players, roll some dice, and Adventure On!

boardgame.name: Ship Deck
boardgame.description:
Game for kids that reward good deeds while pretending to do cruise ship activities in this board game.

The game requires players to get to the pool with the most tokens. There are numerous onboard activities to be enjoyed.

HOW TO PLAY

Players choose a pawn and put it into the pawn stand. Place the cards and tokens next to the ship. Each player flicks the spinner, which determines where to go.
When players land on a card space, they pick a card. 3. Once all players are in the pool, all players count their tokens. The player with most tokens wins the game.
